column4: I'm trying to learn how WEP cracking is done to learn more about security. I got airsnort and am running it, and scanning channel 6 (which I think is the default one?), but I am getting two mac addresses.
I don't want to interfere with what is potentially my neighbors router.
So how do I find out which MAC address is mine and which is his?
ifconfig should tell you which
or traceroute to see which one your machine is routing through
arp will list your arp cache - which will have your router's mac addy
for ifconfig, under ath0 the hwadr is different than both mac addresses I'm picking up.
for ifconfig that is the mac addy of the nic you're seeing.  i was thinking you could use the ip addy to identify the router - forgot you were looking @ mac addresses
ditto the traceroute thing :]
hmmm, something strange, can I pm you?
are you on the system currently?
no, I'm on one beside it
boot the rescue option and yeah, check /etc/hostname
it just says 127.0.0.1 (or whatever that number is) localhost
in /etc/hostname ?
err, that was /etc/hosts/ hold on, I'll switch computers
/hostname just says nicksmachine
that looks ok...
when I logged into gnome it said something about it being a valid internet address, or something strange like that
in /etc/hosts on the line with 127.0.0.1   add nicksmachine at the end of the line.
127.0.0.1 localhost localhost.localdomain nicksmachine      <- like that
how come I never had to do this before? (brb)
did that work?
you have to either relog or source the file
